intro: Astragalus onobrychis f. brevifoliatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bartsia, is a variant of the common bartsia species. It is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and reduced leaf size compared to the typical form. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It is native to parts of Europe and has been introduced to other regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
